title: Macron's historic choice: What voting instructions to give after first round of snap elections
summary: In districts where his coalition's candidates are beaten or trailing in the first round, President Emmanuel Macron will have to decide whether to instruct voters to back the best-placed candidates to beat the far right, even if it means voting for the radical left.

title: French voters tempted by the far right: 'The more they get trashed, the more it makes us want the RN!'
summary: In this department in the Paris region, conservative voters largely approve of leader Eric Ciotti's initiative to ally with the far-right Rassemblement Nationale.

title: French elections: Left's campaign poisoned by anti-Semitism accusations against Mélenchon
summary: Uncomfortable with criticism aimed at La France Insoumise leader Jean-Luc Mélenchon, the other parties in the Nouveau Front Populaire alliance signed a charter to send a positive signal to confused voters.

title: French elections: What if victory was too swift for the far right?
summary: In his column for Le Monde in English, Le Monde's Gilles Paris argues that Emmanuel Macron's surprise decision to call snap elections when the Rassemblement National is in a position to win might also put Marine Le Pen's party in a difficult position.

title: 'The parallel between France and Italy is tempting, but omits an essential element: the size of EU aid'
summary: The economist Philippe Askenazy explains that a Rassemblement National government cannot be as economically successful as Italy's post-fascist government − because Rome receives €200 billion from Brussels, and Paris only €40 billion.

title: French elections poll: Far right holds large lead, with voters split in three blocs
summary: France's June 30 election looks set to confirm the far right's strength, while the left is struggling to catch up. President Emmanuel Macron's coalition, meanwhile, is lagging behind the other two blocs, according to an electoral survey conducted by Ipsos for Le Monde, the Fondation Jean Jaurès, Cevipof, Institut Montaigne, Radio France and France Télévisions.

title: 'The flagship of French anti-doping': The Saclay laboratory gets ready for the Paris Olympics
summary: 'Le Monde' gained access to the laboratory that will be responsible for analyzing all 8,000 samples taken during the Olympic and Paralympic Games.

title: Germany weathers storm to reach the Euro 2024 quarter-finals
summary: Before that, reigning champion Italy was knocked out of the competition by Switzerland. The action continues on Sunday as England takes on Slovakia before Spain faces Georgia.

title: Paris 2024: The horse reigns supreme in Versailles
summary: As the host town for the equestrian events, Versailles has turned its routine upside down to successfully transform into an Olympic city and welcome the tens of thousands of spectators expected in and around the beloved château.

title: Biden tries to calm serious panic as calls to withdraw increase after disastrous debate
summary: The president is trying to quash speculation about his possible withdrawal, despite growing anxiety in the Democratic ranks. An unprecedented editorial in the 'New York Times' on Friday called on him to drop out.

title: French cyclist Bardet wins Tour de France opening stage
summary: Cycling 206 kilometers from Florence to Rimini for a hot and hilly stage, French climber Romain Bardet crossed the line first to claim the first yellow jersey.

title: French elections: 'Who would Don Quixote vote for today?'
summary: William Marx, author of 'A Summer with Don Quixote,' writes that the genius of Miguel de Cervantes lies in leaving the reader 'free to choose' a point in common with democracy.

title: Arsène Wenger: 'Kylian Mbappé has real power in society, which Michel Platini didn't have back then'
summary: In an interview with Le Monde, the former Arsenal manager looks back at the changes in football since the French team's first Euro title in 1984.

title: French elections: The left knows how to get together like no one else. But does it know where it's going?
summary: In his column for Le Monde in English, Le Monde's Gilles Paris writes that even if the left is united, it is weighed down by radical-left figure Jean-Luc Mélenchon.

title: Actor Laurent Lafitte: 'I have never given up on my childhood dreams'
summary: Every week, Le Monde interviews a famous person about a decisive moment in their life. Laurent Lafitte recounts how his life was turned upside down when he read a classified ad in 'France Soir.'

title: In Georgia, LGBT people are the government's new scapegoat: 'It's persecution on a massive scale'
summary: A bill and amendments aimed at depriving sexual minorities of their rights were adopted on Thursday in first reading. These measures, inspired by similar Russian legislation, confirm the pro-Moscow turn taken by the Tbilisi authorities since the start of the war in Ukraine in 2022.

title: As the French elections approach, young queer people are taking to the streets: 'I needed to be with people who understand the urgency for our community'
summary: The Pride marches that traditionally take place at the end of June are more political this year than in previous years. Many young people from the LGBTQ+ community are planning to vote against the far-right RN.

title: Bolivian leader says coup chief wanted to 'take over' as president
summary: Former army chief Juan José Zúñiga, former head of navy Juan Arnez and Alejandro Irahola, former head of the army's mechanized brigade have been remanded in custody for six months.

title: Festivals in Avignon, Aix and Arles: In tune with the world
summary: France's three major summer festivals are opening in a troubled political climate. Now more than ever, they are asserting themselves as spaces for communion around art and universal values.

title: 'The so-called start-up nation is preparing for the end of the Macron era'
summary: Anxiety is in the air for French tech companies, which the president has been supporting for seven years, writes Le Monde journalist Alexandre Piquard.

title: Eighteen killed in multiple Nigeria suicide attacks, according to emergency services
summary: One of the three blasts was caused by a female attacker with a baby strapped to her back in the middle of a wedding ceremony, a police spokesman said.

title: French elections: Why seat projections after the first round might not be reliable
summary: In the past, polling institutes' national estimates of voting percentages have proved fairly reliable. Here, we explain why, in the June 30 vote, these figures will not be enough to know what the Assemblée Nationale will look like after the votes are counted.

title: 'National preference': The Rassemblement National's unconstitutional key promise
summary: For 40 years, the French far right has preached the ostracization of foreigners. Today, it hopes to condition access to social rights including housing and welfare benefits to having French citizenship.

title: French snap elections gate-crash summer festivals
summary: The organization of performances due to take place during the elections on June 30 and July 7 has been disrupted, in what promises to be a tense climate.

title: French elections: 'The disaster of the Brexit years in the UK foreshadows what could await France after July 7'
summary: There is an analogy to be drawn between the potential consequences of the far-right Rassemblement National coming to power and the damage caused by the United Kingdom's exit from the European Union, writes Le Monde columnist Philippe Bernard.

title: In Slovenia, in the slipstream of Tadej Pogacar and Primoz Roglic, cycling has become king
summary: In Slovenia, the two riders, hoping for victory in the Tour de France 2024, have elevated cycling to the status of national sport. On the eve of the race launch on Saturday in Florence, Italy, the craze is stronger than ever.

title: Our five favorite half-and-half pizzas in Marseille
summary: With Emmental cheese and anchovy, the specialty half-and-half pizza is very popular throughout the Southern city. In a Calanques restaurant or a pizzeria in the Panier neighborhood, sitting by a food truck or perched on a rock, here are five spots where you can treat yourself to an iconic 'moit-moit.'

title: French expatriates turn out to vote, worried about the debate on dual nationality
summary: Internet voting has reached record levels. These voters will elect 11 MPs to the Assemblée Nationale.

title: French elections: First round turnout at noon higher than in 2022
summary: A divided France is voting on Sunday in high-stakes parliamentary elections that could see Marine Le Pen's far-right Rassemblement National sweep to power in a historic first.

title: 'Not French enough? It doesn't make sense': Dual nationals upset by the far right's program
summary: They are scientists, doctors, real estate managers... and they have dual nationality. Speaking with Le Monde, they share a deep sense of injustice and their concerns for France.

title: 'France's system is relatively stable, but it was designed for moderate political forces'
summary: Samy Benzina, professor of public law at the University of Poitiers, explains that a far-right prime minister with an absolute majority would have extensive prerogatives, while having to deal with a hostile president and Sénat.

title: 'The strong sense of injustice felt by some French explains the strength of their reaction at the ballot box'
summary: For anyone who paid attention to 30 years of sociological research, the anger expressed during the last elections should have come as no surprise. But did any government actually read the research, asks sociologist Dominique Méda in her column.

title: Jill Biden, a highly political first lady and protector of the American president
summary: The wife of the White House occupant, who had encouraged him to run for a second term, was quick to come to his defense after his disastrous debate with Donald Trump.

title: The new life of Bilal, a former exploited minor: 'The guy who hurt me is free? It's not fair'
summary: It's been two years since, Bilal, 20, was extricated from Paris to try to start a new life in the south of France. The young Algerian had been exploited by two adults who drugged him to force him to steal. An organization managed to rescue him.

title: French elections: Eight articles to understand what's at stake
summary: Why did Macron call snap elections? Why are voters increasingly turning to the far right? And what exactly will happen if Jordan Bardella, becomes prime minister? These are the questions Le Monde's journalists have been looking into during this unprecedentedly short campaign.

title: Snap elections: Why France could become ungovernable
summary: From cohabitation with the far right to the appointment of an apolitical government to manage day-to-day affairs, the dissolution of the Assemblée Nationale means many once unlikely scenarios are now plausible.

title: Are the French becoming more racist?
summary: A report measuring yearly changes in French people's prejudice shows a 'significant and rare' decline in the 'tolerance index.'

title: Tour de France 2024: Pogacar takes overall lead on stage two
summary: The second stage in Italy was won by French rider Kevin Vauguelin, but Tadej Pogacar gained enough time to claim the yellow jersey.

title: Hungary's Orban takes over Council of the European Union presidency for six months
summary: Starting July 1, Hungary will assume the rotating presidency of the Council, during a period of transition for both the Parliament in Strasbourg and the Commission.

title: Deadly storms rage across France, Switzerland and Italy, leaving at least seven dead
summary: The Rhone river burst its banks on Sunday in several areas of Valais canton, flooding a highway and a railway line. The poor weather was making rescue work particularly difficult, police said earlier, with several valleys inaccessible.

title: Paris 2024: Former pole vault world record holder Renaud Lavillenie to miss Olympics
summary: The 2012 Olympic champion failed to achieve the qualifying height to compete at this summer's Games, which would have been his last.

title: French elections: Far right surges in first round, left comes second ahead of Macron's camp
summary: According to initial estimates, the Rassemblement National and its allies got more than a third of the votes, while the left-wing Nouveau Front Populaire alliance bested the supporters of President Emmanuel Macron.

title: French election results: Map of the first round's results
summary: View the results in each of the 577 constituencies of the Assemblée Nationale. Our map will update live as results are counted.

title: French elections: Communist leader unseated by far right
summary: Fabien Roussel, the head of France's Communist party, was beaten by a Rassemblement National candidate who garnered more than 50% of the vote in the first round.

title: Marine Le Pen retains seat in first round of snap elections
summary: The far-right leader said on Sunday she was re-elected in her constituency in northern France.

title: Former president François Hollande qualifies for second round of snap elections
summary: The former president topped the vote as he looks to make a comeback in his old constituency, according to near-complete results.

title: French elections: Far-right Rassemblement National confirms dominance despite wavering promises
summary: The party led by Jordan Bardella and his allies won 34% of the vote, ahead of the Nouveau Front Populaire and the presidential coalition, according to initial national estimates. Never before had the far-right party broken the 20% barrier in a parliamentary election.

title: Macron's coalition further weakened after first round of snap elections
summary: The Rassemblement National and its far-right allies won 34% of the votes, the left-wing Nouveau Front Populaire 28.1% and the presidential coalition 20.3%, according to initial estimates.

title: French elections: Former prime minister Borne risks losing seat
summary: Elected for the first time in 2022, Elisabeth Borne came second in the first round with 28.93% of the vote, trailing the far-right Rassemblement National candidate (36.26%) but ahead of the left-wing Nouveau Front Populaire candidate (23.16%).

title: French elections: Swiftly united left comes out strengthened
summary: The coalition of left-wing parties garnered 28.1% of the vote, behind the Rassemblement National and its allies but ahead of President Emmanuel Macron's coalition.

title: French elections: First-round takeaways
summary: The far-right Rassemblement National made huge gains, Macron lost his gamble and the shape of the future Assemblée Nationale is still unknown.

title: Euro 2024: Spain beats Georgia 4-1 to advance to quarterfinals
summary: Spain will now play host nation Germany in the quarterfinals on Friday, July 5, in Stuttgart.

title: French elections: Prime Minister Attal likely to retain seat after strong first-round showing
summary: Gabriel Attal came out on top in the 10th constituency of Hauts-de-Seine, west of Paris, in the first round of the legislative elections.

title: South Africa announces new government with opposition getting 12 ministries
summary: President Cyril Ramaphosa announced his new government on Sunday following tough coalition negotiations after the ruling ANC lost its outright parliamentary majority. The largest coalition partner, the Democratic Alliance, will hold six portfolios including home affairs, environment and public works.
